channel.title: Digital-Footprint

item.title: Digital-Footprint
item.description:
Challenge Name: Digital Footprint Platform: TryHackMe (Learn > Digital Footprint) Category: OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) Difficulty Level: Easy Type: Beginner-friendly CTF ChallengeOfficial Title: Digital Footprint - Beginner-friendly OSINT Challenge Objective: Utilize OSINT techniques to investigate and locate "flag" through multiple digital investigation methods CTF Type: Jeopardy-style with progressive discovery tasks CTF Relevance: Exif data extraction challenge Process: Download provided image file Use ExifTool to extract metadata: exiftool edited-house-1763031553617.jpg We will obtain map titles from the extracts. Clean and format location data: 26°12'14.8"S 28°02'50.3"E Search in mapping services with corrected coordinates Flag Indicator: The city's name is flag.
CTF Relevance: Historical data investigation Process: Use provided address/coordinates
Search on archive.org Search : `warc-acme.com Click on the displayed result and you get the Firstfiledate Flag Verification: The Firstfiledate value is the flag.

CTF Relevance: Visual intelligence gathering Process: Upload challenge image to Google Images Identify location through reverse search Use Google Maps/Street View for virtual reconnaissance There is a phrase written above the small door on the side Translate this foreign phrase into English Flag Confirmation: The flag is the name found at the building entrance on the map.

CTF Relevance: Multimedia intelligence correlation Process: Reading the text file, we notice that it refers to a video Extract metadata from text file: exiftool internal-docs-1769695301727.odt Identify YouTube username from metadata visit YouTube channel URL We find a message with the flag written at the end of it Final Flag: The flag is at the end of the message.

Metadata Analysis: Understanding how digital files store hidden information Geolocation Techniques: Working with coordinates and mapping services Historical Research: Using archival resources for investigation Visual Intelligence: Reverse image search and street view analysis Social Media Intelligence: Tracing digital footprints across platforms Correlation Analysis: Connecting disparate information sources Flag identification and validation Progressive challenge solving Multiple verification methods Time management in investigation Beginner-Friendly: Introduces core OSINT concepts gradually Practical Application: Real-world investigation techniques Tool Exposure: Familiarization with essential OSINT tools Methodology Development: Structured investigative approach Task 1 (Image Metadata) → Coordinates → "flag" Task 2 (Archive Search) → Historical Records → "flag" ✓ Task 3 (Reverse Image) → Landmark Identification → "flag" ✓ Task 4 (Social Media) → Video Content → "flag" ✓ This "Digital Footprint" CTF challenge successfully demonstrates fundamental OSINT principles through a structured, four-task investigation. The progressive discovery of "Al-Aflaj" across different digital platforms reinforces essential investigative skills while maintaining beginner accessibility. The challenge serves as an excellent introduction to real-world digital investigation techniques within a CTF environment.This report documents the complete walkthrough of the TryHackMe "Digital Footprint" CTF challenge, demonstrating practical OSINT methodology for beginner to intermediate investigators.
